properties.Name: VcfFilter
properties.Description:
The FILTER lines tell you what  filters have been applied to the data.

Ex:
##FILTER=<ID=q10,Description="Quality below 10"> 
##FILTER=<ID=s50,Description="Less than 50% of samples have data">\n
Ex:
 LowDP-Applied to sites with depth of coverage below a cutoff.
LowGQ-The genotyping quality (GQ) is below a cutoff.
LowQual-The variant quality (QUAL) is below a cutoff.
LowVariantFreq-The variant frequency is less than the given threshold.
R8-For an indel, the number of adjacent repeats (1-base or 2-base) in the reference is greater than 8.
SB-The strand bias is more than the given threshold. Used with the Somatic Variant Caller and GATK.

Note:
Records that fail any of the  filters listed here will contain the ID of the  filter (here, LowQual ) in its FILTER  eld (see how records are structured further below).

Columns.Name: ReferenceFile
Columns.Description:
The version of the VCF specification to which the file conforms.

In the flat file received this line will begin with ##reference.

Columns.Name: GeneSequencingFileFormatId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a gene sequencing file format.

Columns.Name: FilterId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the filter.

Properties.Description:
The FILTER lines tell you what  filters have been applied to the data.

Ex:
##FILTER=<ID=q10,Description="Quality below 10"> 
##FILTER=<ID=s50,Description="Less than 50% of samples have data">\n

 LowDP-Applied to sites with depth of coverage below a cutoff.
LowGQ-The genotyping quality (GQ) is below a cutoff.
LowQual-The variant quality (QUAL) is below a cutoff.
LowVariantFreq-The variant frequency is less than the given threshold.
R8-For an indel, the number of adjacent repeats (1-base or 2-base) in the reference is greater than 8.
SB-The strand bias is more than the given threshold. Used with the Somatic Variant Caller and GATK.

Note:
Records that fail any of the  filters listed here will contain the ID of the  filter (here, LowQual ) in its FILTER  eld (see how records are structured further below).
